qas.question: What are a couple examples of Summer music festivals held in Portugal?

answers.text: Festival Sudoeste in Zambujeira do Mar, Festival de Paredes de Coura in Paredes de Coura, Festival Vilar de Mouros near Caminha,

qas.question: What are a couple examples of non-Summer music festivals in Portugal?

answers.text: one of the largest international Goa trance festivals takes place in central Portugal every two years

qas.question: What international awards have been won by the Boom Festival?

answers.text: European Festival Award 2010 – Green'n'Clean Festival of the Year and the Greener Festival Award Outstanding 2008 and 2010

qas.question: In which year did Portugal hold the MTV Europe Music Awards?

context: Portugal has several summer music festivals, such as <a0_0>Festival Sudoeste in Zambujeira do Mar, Festival de Paredes de Coura in Paredes de Coura, Festival Vilar de Mouros near Caminha,<a0_0/> Boom Festival in Idanha-a-Nova Municipality, Optimus Alive!, Sumol Summer Fest in Ericeira, Rock in Rio Lisboa and Super Bock Super Rock in Greater Lisbon. Out of the summer season, Portugal has a large number of festivals, designed more to an urban audience, like <a1_0>Flowfest or Hip Hop Porto<a1_0/>. Furthermore, <a2_0>one of the largest international Goa trance festivals takes place in central Portugal every two years<a2_0/>, the Boom Festival, that is also the only festival in Portugal to win international awards: <a3_0>European Festival Award 2010 – Green'n'Clean Festival of the Year and the Greener Festival Award Outstanding 2008 and 2010<a3_0/>. There is also the student festivals of Queima das Fitas are major events in a number of cities across Portugal. In <a4_0>2005<a4_0/>, Portugal held the MTV Europe Music Awards, in Pavilhão Atlântico, Lisbon.
